member.name: D3D12_FEATURE_DATA_D3D12_OPTIONS6
member.summary: Indicates the level of support that the adapter provides for variable-rate shading (VRS), and indicates whether or not background processing is supported. For more info, see Variable-rate shading (VRS), and the Direct3D 12 background processing spec.

member.name: D3D12_FEATURE_DATA_D3D12_OPTIONS6.AdditionalShadingRatesSupported
member.summary: Indicates whether 2x4, 4x2, and 4x4 coarse pixel sizes are supported for single-sampled rendering; and whether coarse pixel size 2x4 is supported for 2x MSAA. true if those sizes are supported, otherwise false.

member.name: D3D12_FEATURE_DATA_D3D12_OPTIONS6.PerPrimitiveShadingRateSupportedWithViewportIndexing
member.summary: Indicates whether the per-provoking-vertex (also known as per-primitive) rate can be used with more than one viewport. If so, then, in that case, that rate can be used when SV_ViewportIndex is written to. true if that rate can be used with more than one viewport, otherwise false.

member.name: D3D12_FEATURE_DATA_D3D12_OPTIONS6.ShadingRateImageTileSize
member.summary: Indicates the tile size of the screen-space image as a UINT.

member.name: D3D12_FEATURE_DATA_D3D12_OPTIONS6.BackgroundProcessingSupported
member.summary: Indicates whether or not background processing is supported. true if background processing is supported, otherwise false. For more info, see the Direct3D 12 background processing spec.
